newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JUNE 12.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JUNE 12.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
-- Hungarians believe that the country's NATO membership would not only increase military security but also guarantee Hungary's economic development, Defence Minister Gyorgy Keleti said.
-- The employers of a meat processing company in Szekszard, a town in western Hungary, continue to blockade the factory as a protest over delayed payments.
-- Opposition MPs are concerned over the burdens which the planned pension reform would put on the government budget.
-- The government discusses today the first draft of the 1998 budget.
